file_content.text: You don't even have authorization to talk to me.
Time to head off, Cipher--the galaxy's waiting.
Cipher Nine. It's going to be a while before I'm used to saying that.
Looks like we've got a moment of calm. How are you handling everything?
Managing. But I'm ready for whatever's next.
I'm okay.
I'm glad to hear it.
I was going to ask you the same question.
Worried about you.
I appreciate the concern. Honestly, I don't know. The situation with the Dominator... shook me.
I just got promoted. I'm doing very well indeed.
My career's looking good.
Charming, as always.
Look, I apologize if I seemed short with you before. The situation with the Dominator... shook me.
How is it that I can torture a colleague without feeling a thing--but three thousand dead strangers is too much to handle?
After what's happened, it sounds like a normal reaction to me.
That's not strange.
I suppose there's some small comfort in that. Thank you.
The work here... it deadens the conscience. I've seen enough to know that.
This job makes us jaded.
Normally I'm fine with that....
Anyway, I shouldn't bother you with this. I've been monitoring you for too long--I'm starting to think of you as a friend instead of our alien agent.
If we're friends, we're friends. Just because I'm not human doesn't mean we can't get along.
Can't I be both?
I... appreciate that. It takes some getting used to, is all. But thank you.
Why stop with friendship? We're close. Why not get closer?
[Flirt] I can be more.
Cipher--I have great respect for your capabilities. But we aren't compatible in the least.
Of course. I understand.
If you say so.
Regardless, we should probably stop talking.
I was starting to think you weren't so closed-minded.
That's xenophobic garbage.
That's enough. We're both tired--leave it at that.
Anyway, I shouldn't bother you with this. I've been monitoring you for too long--I'm presuming a friendship that doesn't really exist.
If we're friends, we're friends--there's nothing wrong with that.
Who says it doesn't exist?
Perhaps. Friendships aren't always useful in this line of work--but I appreciate the sentiment.
If you girls are finished weeping, can we get going?
Anyway, I shouldn't bother you with this. I've been monitoring you for too long--I'm starting to presume an intimacy that doesn't really exist.
I don't mind talking. Anything I can do, let me know.
I'm just glad to help.
I appreciate that. But I suppose it's time to get back to work.
Presume as much intimacy as you like. I'm not going to complain.
[Flirt] Go ahead.
Oh? What would happen then, though? Where would we end up?
Where do you think we'd end up?
You tell me.
How about my place?
Go off duty for a while, and we can find out together.
I think you'll like it.
You've got a deal.
Imperial Intelligence doesn't discourage its agents from bonding, after all. And that's all this is about--bonding in the aftermath of a crisis.
And creating a little good luck for a change--because after this, we're going to need to get back to work....
That was nice, Cipher. I'm glad we could spend some time together.
But I've got reports to prepare for the Minister of Intelligence, and you've got to go. Our time's up.
I'll be seeing you, Watcher Two. You can't get rid of me this easily.
Only for the moment.
I suppose we'll find out. Take care of yourself.
All right. Let's catch ourselves an Eagle.
Ready to work?
Let's, shall we?
If nothing else, it's been fun.
We enjoyed ourselves.
It has. I think it has.
Honestly, I don't think we'd end up anywhere good.
Sorry--not interested.
Try to stay professional, Watcher Two. There's no room for attachment in this business.
Don't do it again.
Noted, Cipher Nine.
Hold on a second--who did you torture?
You tortured a colleague?
It was before your time, and it had to be done. Don't worry about it.
It's been a long day, and I've still got to send our reports to the Minister of Intelligence. I'm sure you have plenty to do yourself.
I've got an Eagle to catch.
You're right about that.
Whatever you need to make that happen, just ask.
Be safe.
Goodbye.
And you.
This is Watcher Two. Try to take down your opponents without being seen; we don't want to raise an alarm.
No time to talk, agent--we have work to do.
Agent. You did well with Theovor and Samara.
This is Watcher Two. I'm downloading the contents of Theovor's computers--looks like blueprints, work he's done for Lord Grathan, and....
Ah! Encrypted files. I should be able to decipher them if I cross-reference with the slave's datapad....
Mm. I don't like what I'm seeing. There's a timetable, activity convergences, indications of something big. Get back to base as soon as you can.
What do you mean by "something big"?
Please explain.
Not sure yet. The encryption's good--good enough that I can't talk and think it through at the same time.
Acknowledged.
Can't I ever catch a break?
No vacation, huh?
Not in this business. Haven't you learned that by now?
I'll see you soon, agent. Watcher Two out.
Ah! Here we go. Encrypted files, probably related to his work with the radicals. It may take time to decipher them.
I see.
What should I be doing in the meantime?
Are there new orders?
You still need to take care of the situation at the slave camp. There may be something else, as well.
I thought you were an expert at this sort of thing.
You can't go more quickly?
If you'd rather decrypt the information yourself, I wouldn't mind the break. There's something else, though.
Keeper wants you to contact him by holocommunicator as soon as we're done. I can't say why.
You don't know what Keeper wants, or you're not allowed to tell me?
Define "can't."
I don't see a meaningful difference.
I'll place the call right away.
It'll be handled.
I think he probably misses me in there.
He's lonely in that office.
It's... always possible.
I'll be in touch when you need more information. For now, Keeper's waiting.
Agent. We need to know what Theovor Mindak is up to.
This is Watcher Two. Signal established.
I've tapped into the cantina holocams, agent. I can see you from six different angles. We're ready to go.
Give me the rundown.
Excellent.
I didn't realize you could monitor private security.
You can see me?
Imperial Intelligence is authorized to monitor every security system in the Empire. That's how we pinpointed your target.
I can do my job without being watched.
I prefer a little privacy.
Being watched is part of your job; be grateful we make you aware of it.
So--Theovor Mindak is a genius inventor and entrepreneur working with the radicals.
Unfortunately, Theovor is being sheltered by the Sith Lord Grathan. Grathan turns a blind eye to Theovor's "affiliations" in exchange for weapon designs.
Can't we demand that Grathan turn him over? Supporting dissidents is treason.
So we negotiate.
I assume you're not briefing me over drinks for my comfort.
But why am I in a cantina?
No. You're here for a very specific reason.
First Darth Jadus, now Lord Grathan. I'm starting to dislike Sith politics.
Sith keep causing us trouble.
Watch yourself. Statements like that reflect badly on an Intelligence agent--and all of this is on record.
Dealing with Grathan directly isn't an option. He's involved in a power struggle with the other Dark Lords--in essence, he's gone rogue.
However, Theovor's daughter, Samara, frequents this cantina. She has access to Theovor's workshop in Grathan's estate.
I'll talk to her. What's her profile?
Understood.
You think she's willing to turn against family?
Will she help us?
We believe so.
If her father's with the dissident cell, she's probably in league with them, too.
She's the enemy.
Not so far as we're aware--and we've tracked her activities for a while.
Samara Mindak is rich, young and willing to flaunt her advantages. She's popular with the Kaas City elite, but hardly beloved--no meaningful connections or reputation.
Our profile suggests she'll cooperate if given incentives. I've located her in a private lounge; it's up to you how to handle her.
She won't be a problem.
I'll manage.
Is there a standard procedure for this?
What's the best approach?
Just the usual tools of the trade: diplomacy, blackmail and intimidation. Use them well.
If she resists, how far am I allowed to go?
Any limits?
No restrictions. Do what you have to.
Once Samara's told you how to reach her father's workshop, head to Lord Grathan's estate. Send us anything you find on Theovor's computers.
Got it.
I may have to get close to Samara. Are you going to get jealous?
[Flirt] What if I seduce her?
I'll just have to remind myself that you're on the job, agent.
I'm sure Samara and I will be fast friends.
She'll love me.
Undoubtedly.
Theovor had better be worth all this.
It's a lot of trouble.
If he's using his designs to damage our government, then yes, he'll be worth it.
Go. I'll be watching.
Proceed to the Nexus Room cantina in Kaas City. I'll brief you once you're in place.
I'll be there shortly. Anything else?
On my way.
Just make sure you're ready to socialize. Watcher Two out.
I assume you'll pick up my tab. Is there a dress code?
A cantina sounds like fun.
It's a high-class place; something eye-catching. Watcher Two out.
You've been here longer than I have. What does it mean when Darth Jadus calls you in?
What's your opinion of Jadus?
I wouldn't know. It's never happened before.
Catch your breath, then get to the cantina. Watcher Two out.
I'm here. What's the situation?
This is Watcher Two. We're still working on full analysis of the slave's files, but we have a new lead.
You should get going, agent.
Agent--I'm pleased to see you, of course, but I thought you'd be busy with the mission.
Just as well, I suppose--I'm still plotting the details. So what can I do for you?
I figure if we're working together, we should get to know one another.
I wanted to ask about you.
I already know all about you, though--I saw your whole performance on Hutta.
If we talked and shared, you'd be the only one learning from the exchange. And that wouldn't really be fair, now would it?
I'm sure there's something you could share with me.
Come on....
We're partners now, aren't we? Doesn't that count for something?
We have to at least get along.
I can't tell if you're kidding or not.
Was that a joke?
Probably for the best. You don't need to understand me--just let me be the voice in your head and I'll tell you where you need to go.
There are some things I've been wondering about Imperial Intelligence. I thought we could talk.
I need to know about this job.
There isn't much I can tell you that you won't find out yourself. Not anything I'm authorized to share, anyway.
Maybe you can tell me something about yourself.
What about you, personally?
You really want to know who I am?
I'm someone bred for genetic superiority and raised to be a Watcher. I enjoy my work, but I don't like getting close to my agents because they usually get killed.
What about Keeper and Darth Jadus? What's going on there?
Even about that Sith Lord?
Agent... don't get involved in that. You don't survive in this business by getting between your superiors and the Sith.
I'm ready to get going. Brief me on what I need to know.
Get me the mission details.
I told you, I'll send you the details once you're on-site. I promise, I'm not trying to make your life difficult. This is procedure.
Of course--I understand.
No problem.
All right. Contact me via holocommunicator when you're ready to proceed.
Don't I even get a clue about what I'm up against?
I'll settle for a hint.
You don't take this terribly seriously, do you? I'm not sure whether I'm bothered by that or not.
Now we've both got work to do. Contact me via holocommunicator when you're on-site and ready to go, okay?
We'll talk about this more another time.
This isn't over.
Anything for you, beautiful.
[Flirt] Sure thing.
Don't call me that again. I'll see you later.
Sounds good to me. Looking forward to it all.
Got it, partner.
Understood.
Agreed. Goodbye, agent.
Are you always so difficult?
You're being a pain.
Look, I--
I could give you the whole speech about how I'm smarter than you and more experienced than you--but I won't.
We're going to have to work together as equals. I'll try to remember that if you will. All right?
I wouldn't ask for anything else.
Gladly.
Okay. Glad we could resolve that.
You do your part, and I'll do mine--that'll have to suffice.
If we must.
Fair enough.
For now, I need to get back to work. You know your mission, so I'll talk to you soon.
I'm the one out in the field, Watcher Two. I do the job and take the risks. We're not equals.
You're just a bureaucrat.
Then get used to treating me as one anyway. For now, I need to get back to work.
Your business is with Keeper now, agent--not me.
You're to report to Keeper immediately.
I can't help you until Keeper approves. He said he gave you orders of his own.
